subject: Economics
title: Central Bank Digital Currencies: Government Crypto
description: A fast breakdown of Central Bank Digital Currencies: Government Crypto for builders.

hook.text: China's digital yuan lets the government see every transaction in real time. 260 million people already use it.

buildup.text: CBDCs are digital currencies issued by central banks â€” like cash, but programmable and trackable.

discovery.text: Governments can program CBDCs to expire, restricting how and when money is spent. Stimulus that must be used in 30 days.

twist.text: Privacy advocates call CBDCs the end of financial freedom.

climax.text: CBDCs give governments unprecedented control over money. Whether that's utopia or dystopia depends on who governs.

punchline.text: Digital money that the government can program is a new kind of power.

quiz.question: What capability makes CBDCs different from regular digital payments?
options: Governments can program rules into the money itself, like expiration dates
